results.title: Vande Mataram row: Congress cites CWC statement of 1937, says PM 'insulted' Tagore
results.summary:
The Congress party has escalated its criticism of Prime Minister Narendra Modi regarding the 'Vande Mataram' row, accusing him of insulting the 1937 Congress Working Committee (CWC) and Rabindranath Tagore. This follows PM Modi's statement on Friday that crucial stanzas of the national song were dropped in 1937, which he claimed sowed the seeds of partition and represented a 'divisive mindset.'

Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh stated that the CWC, which met in 1937 and included prominent leaders like Mahatma Gandhi, Jawaharlal Nehru, Sardar Patel, and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose, issued a statement on 'Vande Mataram' profoundly influenced by Rabindranath Tagore. The CWC recommended singing only the first two stanzas of the song, citing that they described the beauty of the motherland without religious objection, while subsequent stanzas contained religious allusions that might not be in keeping with other religious groups.

Congress further presented excerpts from Tagore's biography and a letter to Nehru, where Tagore expressed his approval of the first two stanzas but not the latter ones due to their sentiments. Ramesh emphasized that the RSS played no role in the Freedom Movement, making Modi's criticism unsurprising. The party demanded an apology from PM Modi and urged him to focus on contemporary issues like economic inequality, unemployment, and foreign policy rather than historical debates.

results.title: Classmate shoots at class 11 student using father's pistol in Gurugram: Police
results.summary: A Class 11 student was allegedly shot in the neck by a classmate using his father’s licensed pistol at a rented flat in Sector 48 on Saturday night (November 8, 2025). The bullet remains lodged in the victim's neck, and his condition is critical, requiring treatment at a private hospital. Police have apprehended two minor students in connection with the case and registered an FIR at Sadar police station. Authorities recovered the pistol, two magazines, 70 cartridges, and a bullet shell from the scene. The incident occurred around 9:30 pm after a spat between the three classmates present at the flat. According to the victim's mother, her 17-year-old son was invited by his friend, who then insisted on picking him up. Police interrogation revealed that the accused shooter held a grudge against the victim following an altercation two months prior, and the licensed pistol belonged to the accused's father, a property dealer.

results.title: Madhya Pradesh school gets steel plates after video with children eating on newspapers sparks outrage
results.summary: A primary school in Hullapur, Sheopur district, Madhya Pradesh, has received steel plates for its students after a viral video showed them eating their mid-day meals on newspapers, leading to widespread criticism, including from Congress MP Rahul Gandhi. Following the outrage, local authorities, including BJP leader Ramniwas Rawat and SDM Abhishek Mishra, visited the school on Saturday (November 8), joined students for meals on the new steel plates, and confirmed that the premises were spruced up. The self-help group responsible for the meals had its contract cancelled on Friday (November 7), the school in-charge was suspended, and notices were issued to two other staffers. Rahul Gandhi criticized the BJP governments, both state and central, calling their development claims an illusion and expressing shame over the children's lack of dignity.

results.title: Indian envoy Vinay Kwatra, Intel CEO discuss semiconductor, AI plans for India
results.summary: India's Ambassador to the U.S., Vinay Mohan Kwatra, virtually met with Intel's CEO, Lip Bu Tan, on November 8, 2025, to discuss Intel's semiconductor and AI initiatives and plans for India. This interaction supports India's accelerating efforts to develop its semiconductor and AI industries under the India Semiconductor Mission and IndiaAI initiative. The discussion also precedes the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, scheduled for February 19-20 in New Delhi, which will be the first global-scale AI summit hosted in the Global South.

results.title: Uttarakhand formation day: PM Modi inaugurates projects worth ₹8,260 crore
results.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, on Sunday, November 9, 2025, inaugurated and laid the foundation stone for various projects worth ₹8,260 crore in Uttarakhand to commemorate 25 years since the state's formation. He lauded Uttarakhand's overall progress, noting that infrastructure projects worth ₹2 lakh crore are currently underway and the state budget has grown from ₹4,000 crore to over ₹1 lakh crore in 25 years. Modi also suggested Uttarakhand could become the world's spiritual capital due to its numerous pilgrimage sites. The projects encompass key sectors such as drinking water, irrigation, technical education, energy, urban development, sports, and skill development, including specific initiatives like Dehradun's AMRUT water supply scheme, an electrical substation in Pithoragarh, solar power plants, and an AstroTurf Hockey Ground in Haldwani.
